intro: Bulbostylis scabricaulis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed bulbostylis, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female structures, and it relies on wind pollination. Bulbostylis scabricaulis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
